Outdated as fuck. VR performance requirements have shot WAY up since this software was made.

Here's my recommendations for minimum specifications of modern PCVR hardware:

GPU: NVIDIA GTX 1060 or equivalent
CPU: Ryzen 5 2600 or equivalent
RAM: 12GB(16GB recommended)
Storage: 512GB SSD(Recommended at least 1TB)
I/O: At least 2 USB 3.0 ports in the front, and at least two free ports in the back(some will be taken by your KB/mouse and maybe your Wi-Fi adapter)
Display: At least one free HDMI and one free DisplayPort slot

I have a 5800X AND RTX 3070. The test caps out at 300 fps but only renders at the vive's ~2160x1200. Even the Quest 2 has 1920x1832 PER EYE.

This needs an update, both for new rendering hardware and performance targets. I know it's meant to be basic, but just add some custom resolution scaling and uncap the fps and it will be useful for years to come. 
Have a PIMAX 8K or Varjo VR3? Crank the resolution to fit your needs. That easy. 
Can't afford a high end PC? Lower the resolution and see what upscaling you need to get 90 fps.

I wanted to use this to test the openVR FSR/NIS API, but even native rendering hits the frame cap constantly.

108325564.review: When running this test on a gaming laptop with two GPUs. Like in the case of mine where I have an APU with a dedicated nVidia included. Only the embedded GPU will be listed as running, even if the nVidia is actually running. Don't know if Valve actually cares to fix it, since it doesn't really affect anything other than the name of the unit. But all in all, it does it's job and will help you to see if your device is likely to be able to run a VR set. On the note of a laptop, if you only have USB-c you will (in the case of an index) need a USB-C (male) to DisplayPort (female) adapter/etc.. Make sure the adapter is capable of running high (at least the VR unit minimum per eye (2x)) resolution over at least 60fps. Otherwise it might not be able to run the VR. Because far from all adapters are able to, just so you don't needlessly waste your money.

It seems like since the latest Steam VR patch. My VIVE Wireless has pixel glitches/stuttering, making it impossible to play.  I am using an I7 4790k with nvidia 1060and 32gigs RAM.  yes, older video card, but I used to run the same games on an i5 and they ran smooth using the vive wireless. Now, it doesn't matter what processor I use i5 or i7, I cannot get back to the performance I once had. I am reluctant to put the reconnect the cable as I know it will fix this. But, you should not be tethered in VR if possible.  
I have flashed the MB BIOS and updated the video card drivers and rolled them back, and reinstalled them. Still I get a pixel glitch or stutter.  

This is been well documented that the VIVE wireless adapter can drag performance down. But, again.. it was running fine with the i5 before as well and is not now.  I have tried all of the various tips. Set CPU to GEN 3 and turn off CPU Turbo Boost, setting the CPU priority to HIGH even Real Time. Made various changes in the Steam VR settings.  Nothing fixed it. However, most of these post are all around 2018 with most of the conclusion that it was a either a Steam VR update that had happened or Nvidia driver update.  As I stated I rolled back to several drivers and no improvement.   I have uninstalled and reinstalled Steam VR. No improvement.  When I do the Steam VR performance test. It tells me that I am READY that I scored a 7.9. which is highly ready per the tool.   I am lost at this point and don't want to have to put the chains, err I mean cable back on.   Specs:  Windows 10-64 Bit/ i7 4790k / 32g RAM/ Nvidia 1060/ HTC VIVE/ VIVE Wireless Adapter.

94384564.review:
After 100 hours in this game, I feel I can finally give a proper review on this wonderful game.


SteamVR Performance Test brings new flavour to a video game format that has remained unchanged for ages. SteamVR Performance Test brings new life to the idea of a "Open World MMO RPG" that has never been seen before. The world is well detailed and filled with a shit ton of interesting and fun mechanics.

In almost any MMO there is a grind to level up and get new gear, but the way this game does it is tasteful. They keep things fun, and most times I don't realize I am grinding because I am having so much fun. Although grinding with friends is not as fun as it should be, as the game scales the difficulty too dramatically per user in your world.

The story is fantastic. I am usually a strictly combat player, but this story truly has me pulled in. The lore is deep and fascinating, even for a dude like me who usually hates story. Almost everything in the game has something deep tied to it, and it is all easily accessible in the game. However some of it is really not needed, like why do they need to specify that Ricardo is gay? (Ricardo is your pet dog for context)

Overall great game, 10/10. Would recommend if you catch on sale!

93663742.review: I'd have to say this is one of my favorite vr games of all time, wait no take that back. One of my favorite games of all time period. First off, the graphics are astounding, the visuals are stunning, and the audio quality is just breathtaking. There's literally nothing bad I could say about this game. It's just a true form of art, it doesn't even seem like a game because it's so good. It's like watching a top tier movie, or reading the greatest book of all time. I gotta say, I'd give it a solid 10/10, it would be nice to have a multiplayer option in the game, but it's fine even in single player. I really hope that one day, more people can experience this true gem of a game, and that it gets the love it deserves. I really hope that there'll be a part 2, or maybe even a part 2 episode 1 knowing how valve doesn't like their 3's. Even so, I could just replay this game again, and again so many times. The replay value of it is just so great, it's kinda like a fine wine. The longer you have it, the better it gets. I do have to say though, you do not need vr for this game, which is a massive plus for most people. Cause y'know vr is kinda expensive, and not a lot of people can afford it. Either way, you're gonna love this game no doubt about it, hell I cried the first time I played it, I had to have my family hold me back from the computer cause I couldn't stop looking at it. Hopefully it doesn't happen to you, but it most likely will. I love this game so much, I can't even begin to express it, this is just the surface of my love for it. Tl;dr: I love this game so frickin' much.

93207048.review:
This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

An aging piece of software. The score ranges from 0 to 11. I got a 10.9, have come from systems that rated me 4.5 - 6 and I'm finally am at an 11 basically. To those with laptops, it's good you notice this tool isnt working you will likely need to adjust the settings in the NVIDIA control panel to make sure nothing is running on the iGPU (Intel GPU chip) This can be done by preferring the GPU chip for all applications, just expect not to have a good battery life afterwards. It can be a real pain to use a laptop with vr, but its worth it! So glad to not be using a laptop anymore.

This, i don't have a problem with, what i do have a problem with is the lack of detail on the dropped frames and the oddly high standard. Were the frames below 90 at 89 fps? 80? 70? 60? were the drop in frames negligible? would they make someone sick? I'd recommend running this test with fraps to see more detail on your performance. On the topic of the high standard, i'd say you don't need a locked 90 fps to enjoy VR. In my past experience with my old headset and what I've heard from other Youtubers, you only need at least 60 fps to not be sick, i didn't even know my headset had locked itself at 60Hz until I checked its settings a month in. 63522970.review: Doesn't seem to be able to detect my GTX 1050 despite the GPU itself detecting the program, and even after I brute forced it in Windows and Nvidia settings smh. Oddly for unknown reasons, my Intel UHD 630 that gets detected is considered to be capable of running VR titles at decent settings and performance. But based on my research, it seems the 1050 should barely be enough as a minimum GPU for VR, while the officially listed GTX 970 is overkill for minimum requirement. Honestly, I think GTX 770 should be bare minimum (15% stronger than 1050) and instead of GTX 1070 being recommended - which I also find to be overkill, the GTX 1060 or 1660Ti should be enough. And maybe Valve is dumb, since my i5 9300H processor was detected as having 8 cores, when in reality it's like other i5 mobile processors with only 4 cores and 8 threads max - hell, even desktop i5 only have 6 cores max.

61072204.review:
Does work as intended.  Ran this on my old system, which has AMD A8-5500 APU ( 2 cores, 4 threads ) and did see my GTX 1050 TI GPU. Said my old computer was barely into Upgrade Recommended but capable of VR. I bought the HTC Vive set in 2018 and used it with my Old system, many VR apps didn't work or had terrible performance.

I built my new computer, then installed SteamVR and the HTC Vive. This new computer: Ryzen 5 2400G, RTX 2070 Super, Win 10 Pro, 16 GB RAM, 500 GB SSD, 4 TB HD.
My new computer tested at a few points below the top of the scale in VR Ready.  Having no problems with SteamVR and running most VR apps now.  Use this program to find out if you can run SteamVR and a VR system on your computer, before you buy a VR HMD set, does not need a VR unit to run.

Bought a Valve Index in 2023.

Don't buy a HTC Vive now, there are better VR systems out there.

Whatever issues about it defaulting to on board graphics has been solved.  This thing's a hungry beast...  ran 15,000 frames at 90 frames/second, dropped none of them *pats computer*... 

Discovered the temp sensors on the gpu work, never seen it it on before tonight, and it crept up to 2053 RPM...  

TIL:  Be psychotically certain to to dust your heat sinks, check your airflow, and ensure case/card fans are keeping things below critical temps cause VR's default setting is "oven."

60398764.review: The SteamVR Performance Test measures your system's rendering power using a 2-minute sequence from Valves Aperture Robot Repair VR demo. After collecting the data it determines whether your system is capable of running VR content at 90fps and whether VR content can tune the visual fidelity up to the recommended level. For machines that are not VR Ready the tool can help determine whether capabilities are bound by Graphics Card, CPU, or both.

57553933.review:
Works great, but unfortunately will always default to the integrated GPU instead of the dedicated one.

On Windows 10 this can be fixed by going to "settings > Gaming > Related Settings: Graphics > Add Application" and then going to this file in the SteamVR benchmark tool's directory, then selecting High Performance mode:

[h1]/bin/win64/vr.exe[/h1]

This is something that should already be fixed by Valve, not manually checked by the user. Someone could easily mistake the results as being for their dedicated card and think that their system is less powerful than it is, leading to pointless upgrades and other such problems when desperately trying to find a GPU that will pass the test.

For any GTX 1050 users out there, your computer is more than capable of VR. If the test fails, that's just Valve lying to you.

49349917.review:
This... this is the pinnacle of gaming.
There will be a TL;DR at the end, do not fret.

Let's get right into it with the pros, and I'll round off the end of the review with the cons.

[u] PROS: [/u]

Where to begin? The gameplay is solid. Like. [b] REALLY SOLID. [/b] I've never played a game that's felt so responsive, so immersive, and made me feel so in control. At this point I legitimately believe that every second I spend not playing this game is a second wasted on a lesser existence. Not a single other game will ever bring you the amazing gameplay that this one provides, I can PROMISE you this.

The story is, on the surface, simple but good. But when you really delve into the lore of this game, you realize just how complex it all is. It's incomprehensible that any developer could put out a product with a universe full of lore that is only accessible to those who seek it. You can easily just play through this game and think [i] "Sure, it's just a VR test. Sure, that's just a robot getting fixed". [/i] I'm glad I took the time to hunt down all the secrets and easter eggs, because I could've easily been one of the simpletons who missed out on this incredibly deep and thought provoking roller coaster of sorrow and triumph. To say the story is fantastic is an understatement. This is downright stupendous, and possibly the only thing that the word 'stupendous' could ever legitimately be used on. If you ever use stupendous for anything other than this game, not only are you detracting from the value of the word but you are also making yourself out to be a fool and a liar.

Next we'll talk about the characters. For the sake of avoiding spoilers, I won't name any or explain anything about them. (If you're curious, just delve in to the game yourself.)
All (and I do mean ALL) of the characters in this game are contenders for the most well written characters of all time. In anyting. The character development (especially when you've explored the lore of this title) is astonishing. I daresay that these characters feel more real and thoughtfully crafted than pretty much any human you have or ever will met/meet. 
[b] WARNING: [/b] As a result of this, all future encounters with lowly human interaction may become mundane and meaningless as you'll start to realize just how little depth your average human can have.

This game's world design is something to behold; Like a work of art that unfolds gracefully with each step you take. Every twist and turn is hand crafted to appeal to all 5 of a human's senses at once, and you can easily tell that whoever was in charge of art direction truly, TRULY loves their work. If I ever met this person, I do believe I'd be forced to offer my firstborn to pay for the privilege of gazing upon their exquisite form. 
The resolution of every texture on every item and object in this massive expanse of a world is (with no other word to properly describe it) a miracle given digital form. You will most likely cry every time you look upon a proper expanse of in game world. 
(Side note: keep tissues on standby)

I'm afraid I'll have to cut it short as I haven't the time to properly write about this game's good sides. Given the time I'd gladly write 10,000 more words on each of the above categories. But, alas, I must hurry to get back to playing this game.

[u] CONS: [/u]

There is only one, [b] ONE SINGLE THING, [/b] that I could possibly even begin to think of as a con for this game. 
And that is the simple fact that it's free. It feels like I'm cheating God himself by not paying for this product. I am actually really upset that I can't seem to find a Patreon or a PayPal of any of the creators of this game. I'm really hoping they patch in a pricetag (Realistically I'd say it should be around $100 if the creators really want to set a low bar for the sake of us measly gamers) and retroactively force all owners of the software to pay for it, with obvious increases on billing to match the amount of time that we've played the game. We gotta pay for all the bliss it has provided us with beforehand, it's only fair.

And finally, the end note.


[b] TL;DR [/b]
Game is really great.
Shut up and take my money, [u] PLEASE. [/u]

47939988.review:
Play. This. Game. NOW! This game is an absolute masterpiece. Even though the developers were on a low budget, and the graphics aren't the greatest, this game proves time and time again that a good game doesn't mean good rewards, good graphics, good controls, or anything of that nature. It proves that good games are games that have CHARM and STORY.

The game begins when it zooms on in a bedroom in the middle of a city apartment. The boy in this apartment is named yams. When you first see him, you think 'uhhh... i hope this isn't the main character, this guy looks like a total chad'. And he is. Yams is a total chad who loves football and gets all the girls. He is also a jerk to pretty much everyone around him. Alas, just as the great anime 'Avatar: The Last Airbender' proves, chads can become someone great. And that is what this game does. You follow Yams as he becomes a magnificent creature of a man, fighting through space as a space pilot, becoming the mayor of cities and winning multiple upon multiple 'Mayor of the year' awards, donating billions of dollars (which he accrued by creating the sole company which completely cured world hunger everywhere) to charity, winning the highest medals in the military you can be awarded in 2 YEARS, AND HE TERRAFORMED MARS! The character development just continues to get greater and greater and greater. Everytime I think 'Character Development' I think THIS GAME.

YAMS. IS. THE. BEST. CHARACTER. IN. ANY. FORM. OF. MEDIA. PERIOD.

Now, for the gameplay. The gameplay is the most awe inspiring thing to ever stimulate my virgin eyeballs. I cannot believe the depth that goes into every single PIXEL of gameplay in this game. It made me FEEL like YAMS. Push Virtual Reality aside, because this is a whole NEW LEVEL. Just when you even FATHOM getting SLIGHTLY bored of the current gameplay,  it switches to a whole new game almost, completely resetting anything that you think this game would be. This game is a city simulator, but you can make an avatar and walk around your city as a person. It also has the aspects of stardew valley, where you can befriend citizens, and they will help you with city tasks. Before it is a city simulator, it is a simulator such as Sid Meier's Civilization, where you start in the stone age and progress through time! Based on your choices of where your citizens live, and the climate, and also the technologies they develop, it completely changes how the humans look, if you can even call them humans by the time it is a city sim. After you get far enough in your city, you have the chance to try curing cancer, and getting world peace. That is no ordinary feat, but it is a walk in the park for ya boy Yams. Watch as Yams works EFFORTLESSLY, curing cancer and getting world peace. The way you do this is with 'Yam points', which is whenever you do something nice to the citizens, you get yam points. You get enough yam points and you can accomplish amazing tasks in the game.

Whenever you get far enough in the city simulator, you create a space station, and you lift off to the cosmos! You can choose from many space captains to fly each spaceship, but of course I always choose Yams. Yams is the greatest leader I have ever known, and it is no different when it comes to flying a spaceship. You have nearly unlimited customization on your spaceship, including the name. I gave my rocket ship the name 'Y.I.T.B.S.P.I.T.U" (it stands for yams is the best space pilot in the universe). Space exploration is just incredible in this game. The colors are so vibrant, and comfortable. You may meet other space-faring civilizations in space as you are flying around, and you can communicate to them. Funny enough, I met another species one time flying around, and I told them my name was 'Yams'. When I said that, the leader of this species kissed me on the cheek, and the rest of them clapped. Apparently 'Yams' means I love you in k̷͉̐v̸͎̀o̷̪͕͊̇ŗ̵͖̓k̶͉̬͂́'̸͇̒͂t̵̺͔̓̿ḫ̵͒l̵̰̣̆, HAHA, good times! 

As your technology grows more advanced, you have the ability to try terraforming. This is a long process, but do I have to say IT IS EXTREMELY FUN. The basis is to basically warm up the atmosphere of a planet, genetically modify cannabis to grow on the planet's soil, and then let it grow like crazy. The best method is to water all of the plants by dumping water by the tons out of a planter spaceship (a planter spaceship is a spaceship meant for growing plants). You get water by capturing comets in the solar system and extracting the water from all the ice on the comet. Eventually, you terraform the planet. The way to test this is take off your spacesuit's helmet for 5 seconds at a time. If you can breathe, then great the planet is done! If your head explodes, then oops! You should have waited a little longer, idiot. 

After terraforming a planet, Yam's will planet the seed of life. Creatures will begin to develop on the planet, and then you leave them alone. The gift of life will be given to the planet you terraform.

And then....

After your space-faring civilization flies away to a much farther universe, accomplishing amazing things humans could never even comprehend,

Civilization starts again, on the planet that was once terraformed.

You start back in the stone age on the new planet, evolving throughout history. This time history is much different than Ol' Yam's civilization. You have new things that can happen. New mutations, new plants. And alas, as the city starts to grow. You pan into an apartment room. It's the chad, himself. Yams. But this time, he is slightly different, his arms may be longer, or made of claws or something similar. But there he is. You follow the new Yams as he becomes an awesome human-thing or whatever the new species is. 

That is why this game is amazing, because of the creativity and pure replayableness. 

And that is why I, YAMS RECOMMEND THIS GAME.

41768756.review:
I'm glad something like this exists. It's awesome. But how it is now, it's not working at all. It's way too needy in terms of what you have in your computer, and even if it says your machine isn't ready, it's easy to be proven wrong.

However, I still recommend this program. If you just ignore the summary that Steam gives you at the end, you can get a pretty good gauge of performance yourself. If you have an FPS counter, you can clearly see what your real performance is. I get well over the required 90 frames with my GPU, and I can see that the settings on it have hardly dipped below Very High. Not sure what's going on with the report, but it says that it fails and drops frames, even at Low settings. However, I've actually done plenty of VR on this machine, and even at the highest settings, my machine just rips through it, not even skipping a beat unless at loading, which is kind of expected.

If you want to know how your machine performs in VR, use this and stick around to really watch its performance. I know for a fact if you have anything at GTX 760 4GB performance or better, you can definitely run VR.

41494146.review:
I've had this game for over a year, and I've finally decided to give it a more thorough review. Keep in mind that this is only my opinion, and your view on the game will almost certainly be different.

Let me tell you, as someone who has put 40+ hours into this title, it definitely lives up to its description. The plot is simple, well-written, and incredibly easy to follow. I give story elements a solid 9/10.

Although it's somewhat quick to complete, it offers a replay value that cannot be compared to any other game. No matter how many times over you play the game, you'll realize that having a potato computer is alright in the grand scheme of things. I'll give that an 8/10.

Finally, the price. Although most people don't even acknowledge this game's price point, I'm concerned that it's overpriced. As much as the game is worth, it's not worth $0.00. This is why I propose that Valve decreases the price to a more affordable -$4,500.00, which would certainly increase the game's appeal to the budget market. A change like this is required because seeing the arrow selected over the 'Not Ready' segment of the visual aid increases the chances of being afflicted with a minor case of serious depression. As such, the proposed price point would cover a fraction of the individual's mental health bills.

Nonetheless, I would recommend this game to everyone who is genuinely interested in how their computer's specifications line up with the 2016 VR standard. 
 Cheers!
